intro: Themistoclesia cremasta, commonly known as the spiny poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small yellow flowers, which are often mistaken for petals. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil.
